title: Here’s How Much Tax Australians Will Pay Under New Stage Three Rules
description: Australia’s wealthiest are set to lose out as the government tweaks tax changes to help low- and middle-income earners struggling with soaring living costs.

title: Argentina’s Congress Delays Vote on Milei’s Key Reform Proposals
description: Argentina’s congress delayed at least until next week a vote on President Javier Milei’s austerity measures due to lack of consensus on key proposals to raise taxes and change the country’s pension system.

title: US Plans ‘Bigger Picture Exam’ of Boeing Issues, Buttigieg Says
description: The Biden administration will undertake a wide-ranging review of oversight and quality control at Boeing Co. after the planemaker’s latest missteps, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said Wednesday.

title: After New Hampshire Primary, Trump and Biden Court Union Workers
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Jordan Fabian writes about President Biden’s battle for union workers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Canada Officially Adds India to Its Probe of Election Meddling
description: Canada’s public inquiry into foreign interference will examine allegations that India sought to meddle in recent national elections, potentially inflaming already-elevated tensions between the two countries.

title: Colombia’s Foreign Affairs Minister Suspended Amid Investigation
description: Colombia’s Foreign Affairs Minister Alvaro Leyva was suspended over potential irregularities in a bidding process for the provision of passports in the country.

title: China Officials Told Xi’s Belt-Tightening Rules Are Here to Stay
description: No stationery at government meetings, a ban on flashy buildings, and inspectors to watch for food wastage at official functions.

title: Biden Will Veto Republican Measure Blocking EV Chargers Plan
description: President Joe Biden will veto a congressional resolution that sought to block a partial waiver to Buy-American requirements on the White House’s plan to spend $7.5 billion on electric vehicle chargers.

title: Biden’s Allies Privately Warned His Campaign, Sparking a Shakeup
description: President Joe Biden’s recent campaign shakeup came after growing concerns from allies and private warnings to his inner circle about his weaknesses in a matchup against Donald Trump.

title: Russian Troops Begin Burkina Faso Deployment to Bolster Security
description: Russia bolstered its influence in the troubled Sahel region of West Africa with about 100 military personnel from the country arriving in Burkina Faso on Wednesday, the first large deployment in that nation.

title: Biden Secures UAW’s Endorsement After Turn on Picket Line
description: The United Auto Workers union endorsed Joe Biden’s 2024 reelection bid, with the group’s head calling questions about the 81-year old president’s age “bullsh*t.”

title: UK Tells Telegraph Buyer Redbird It Faces Possible Second Probe
description: The UK government is considering a fresh investigation into the acquisition of the Telegraph newspaper, a move which could effectively reset the ongoing probe that was set to present its findings on Friday.

title: Venezuela, Guyana to Hold Talks in Brazil Over Disputed Region
description: The foreign ministers of Venezuela and Guyana will meet Thursday in Brazil, following through on a pledge last month aimed at mitigating tensions over the disputed Essequibo territory.

title: Scholz Is Confident Orban Will Approve Sweden's NATO Bid
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that he’s confident that Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban will cease to block Sweden’s accession to NATO. He also sounded confident that Orban will wave through a €50 billion ($54.5 billion) support package for Ukraine at an extraordinary EU summit next week.

title: Trudeau’s Rival Wants Canada to Reimpose Mexico Visa Requirement
description: The head of Canada’s main opposition party called on Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government to reimpose visa requirements on Mexico after a sharp spike in asylum claims.

title: Uranium Producer Niger Launches Mining Sector Overhaul
description: Niger temporarily suspended the granting of new mining licenses, the first step in an audit of its mining sector as it seeks to boost government revenue.

title: Wall Street Donors Keep Haley’s 2024 Run Afloat, Even If Voters Won’t
description: Nikki Haley is spurning calls to drop out of the Republican presidential primary after her New Hampshire loss, vowing to press on with her unlikely bid thanks to the backing of Wall Street titans.

title: Chile Lower House Approves Base Text of President Gabriel Boric’s Pension Reform
description: Chile’s lower house of Congress approved the base text of President Gabriel Boric’s pension reform, while rejecting a key clause, damping government celebrations over one of its few legislative achievements.

title: Politics in Stereo: The Readout With Allegra Stratton
description: A party on the right of politics is choosing their candidate for the next election. You might think we’re talking about Donald Trump’s battle with Nikki Haley in New Hampshire, but we could also be talking about the UK.

title: Weak UK Tory Rebels Struggle to Undermine Unpopular Rishi Sunak
description: A senior Conservative politician who used a major newspaper to warn of electoral “catastrophe” if the ruling party keeps Prime Minister Rishi Sunak likely hoped for a better response. Instead, the anger leveled at Simon Clarke by his colleagues underscored the collective bind they are in.

title: US Embassy Smooths Ruffled UK Feathers Over ‘Perfect’ Tea Study
description: The US and UK have traditionally enjoyed a so-called special relationship as close allies bound by a common language. But that goodwill has been jeopardized by an American academic who claims that the recipe for a perfect cup of tea includes a pinch of salt.

title: UK Town Halls Get £600 Million Boost After Bankruptcy Warnings
description: The UK government handed English councils a £600 million ($765 million) top-up to their budgets for the next financial year after concerns that a wave of local authorities were heading toward bankruptcy.

title: Italy’s Meloni Picks Fight With Stellantis Over Car Production
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni blasted Stellantis NV for its efforts to move car production to lower-cost countries at a time when the auto industry is struggling to shift to electrification.

title: NATO Has Been Underestimating Russia’s War Machine, Estonia Says
description: Estonia’s top military commander said fresh intelligence on Russia’s ability to produce ammunition and recruit troops has prompted a re-evaluation among NATO allies and a spate of warnings to prepare for a long-term conflict.

title: Saudi Arabia Prepares to Open Liquor Store, But Only For Diplomats
description: Saudi Arabia is about to open its first liquor shop in decades as it increasingly loosens social restrictions - but alcohol will only be sold to diplomats.

title: One for the Swear Jar: Starmer and Sunak Get Personal
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Future of US Drone Base Hinges on Niger’s Return to Democracy
description: The future of a US military drone base in Niger hinges on the ruling junta’s efforts to restore democracy and release ousted President Mohamed Bazoum, a top US official said Wednesday.

title: China Beefs Up Support for Developer Funding By Easing Loan Uses
description: Chinese regulators boosted support for struggling developers by widening the use of some commercial loans, its latest effort to stem a property slowdown and revive market confidence amid a stock market rout.

title: Talks on New Cease-Fire Between Israel and Hamas Face Hurdles
description: Negotiators between Israel and Hamas have put forward a detailed proposal to both sides for a permanent cease-fire, according to two people with knowledge of the talks, though many obstacles remain.

title: Hungary Plans to Ratify Sweden’s NATO Bid, Orban Says on X
description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Hungary will ratify Sweden’s accession to NATO and that he will urge parliament to do so “at the first possible opportunity,” according to the leader’s post on X.

title: Israel Says Hamas Gets Online Donations Via Groups Posing as Gaza Charities
description: Israeli officials estimate Hamas is getting $8 million to $12 million a month through online donations, much of it through organizations posing as charities to help civilians in Gaza.

title: Argentina’s General Strike Poses Test for Milei’s Austerity Plan
description: Argentina’s labor movement is staging a general strike that will test popular support for President Javier Milei’s austerity blitz less than two months into his presidency.

title: Australia to Limit Tax Cuts for Rich to Aid Low-Income Earners
description: The harsh economic reality confronting many Australians means Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is set to break a key campaign promise.

title: Turkish Ruling Party Sees ‘Not Much’ Room for Further Rate Hikes
description: Turkey has little room for further monetary tightening, said a senior ruling party official in charge of the economy, calling for additional measures beyond central bank policy to combat inflation.

title: How Red Sea Crisis Raises, Inflation, Supply Chain Worries Anew
description: By attacking ships plying the Red Sea, Yemen’s Iran-backed Houthi rebels have caused the biggest disruption to global trade since the Covid-19 pandemic and provoked a military response, including US and UK airstrikes on Yemen. The Houthis say they are acting in solidarity with Palestinians amid the war between Israel and the militant group Hamas. The dangers in the Red Sea have increased costs for operators still plying its waters and prompted shipping companies to reroute much of the sea’s norm

title: Orban Set to Fold on Sweden’s NATO Bid After Overplaying Hand
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is poised to prepare his lawmakers to ratify Sweden’s accession to NATO after Turkey’s parliamentary approval effectively left Budapest as the lone holdout to the alliance’s enlargement.

title: EU Takes Limited Steps to Strengthen Economic Security
description: The European Union issued a series of modest proposals aimed at protecting some key technologies as it tries to counter a growing rivalry with China and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Stars Aligning for India’s Modi In Third-Term Bid
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Erdogan Backs Economy Team After Claims Against Central Bank Chief
description: Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan made an apparent show of support for the country’s economic leadership, following allegations against the central bank governor.

title: France and India to Discuss Accord on Small Nuclear Reactors
description: India is aiming to cooperate with France on the development of small modular nuclear reactors, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government seeks to expand its options to curb the country’s reliance on coal.

title: Iranian Drones Become Latest Proxy Tool in Sudan’s Civil War
description: Iran has supplied Sudan’s army with combat drones, taking sides in a disastrous civil war fueled by proxies keen for Red Sea access that has displaced millions and risks destabilizing the wider region, according to senior Western officials.

title: When Stocks Crash, China Turns to Its ‘National Team’
description: It rose to prominence when China’s stock market imploded in 2015, spending billions of dollars on equities as the authorities hurried to stem the losses. Now, with more than $6 trillion wiped off the value of Chinese and Hong Kong shares since a peak in 2021, there’s high anticipation that the “national team” will ride to the rescue once more.

title: German Firms in China Say Economy Is on ‘Downward Trajectory’
description: Most German companies in China think the Asian nation’s economy is declining and will take at least a year to rebound.

title: Three Takeaways From Trump’s New Hampshire Win
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. In this special edition, Bloomberg Businessweek columnist Joshua Green analyzes the results of yesterday’s New Hampshire primary. The regular newsletter will return this afternoon. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Russia Says Military Plane With 65 Ukrainian POWs Crashed
description: Russia said a Defense Ministry plane carrying 65 Ukrainian military prisoners as well as nine crew and guards crashed in the Belgorod region near the border with Ukraine.

title: Philippines’ Marcos to Give Keynote Speech at Top Defense Forum
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. will deliver the keynote address at Asia’s top security summit this year, giving the Southeast Asian leader a high-profile platform to speak amid tensions with Beijing in the South China Sea.

title: Singapore Imposes Movement Curbs on ‘Self-Radicalized’ Teenager
description: Singapore issued a 16-year-old male citizen with a restriction order in November after finding that he was self-radicalized by online far-right extremist propaganda.

title: Shawn Fain Takes On Musk, Trump Over Labor’s Green Future
description: The UAW’s newish president won Big Three autoworkers their best deals in decades. Now he’s after Tesla, EVs and the rest of the industry.

title: Iran President Visits Turkey for Security Talks
description: Iran’s president will visit Turkey on Wednesday to discuss the war in Gaza and cooperation against Kurdish militants, as the neighbors seek to boost security against a backdrop of growing instability in the Middle East.

title: French Farmers Plan More Protests in Growing Clash With Macron
description: France’s farmers continued to block major roads across the country on Wednesday, demanding urgent action from President Emmanuel Macron’s government to cut back costs and burdensome regulation.

title: Moldova Reshuffles Government to Bolster EU Accession Efforts
description: Moldovan Prime Minister Dorin Recean reshuffled his government on Wednesday, seeking to assemble a new team of diplomats to move forward the country’s effort to join the European Union.

title: Senior China Envoy Dismisses Qin Gang Removal as ‘Not Uncommon’
description: One of Beijing’s most senior diplomats dismissed concern over the ouster of former Foreign Minister Qin Gang, in rare public comments from a Chinese official about the mysterious episode.

title: Russia’s War Fuels a Wage Spiral That Threatens Army Recruitment
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine is intensifying an acute deficit of workers that’s hitting businesses from metal refineries to posh Moscow restaurants and igniting a race to increase salaries that threatens the Kremlin’s ability to replenish the armed forces.

title: China Officials Step Up Rhetoric to Lift Market Confidence
description: Chinese authorities boosted messages of policy support in a bid to stabilize market confidence, underscoring the heightened concern to stem the rout in stocks.

title: Modi Rides Religious Wave in Bid to Clinch Third Term in Power
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s opening of a controversial Hindu temple on Monday blurred the lines between religion and politics in a way that challenges India’s secular tradition. Yet it’s left few doubts of the leader’s unquestioned dominance just months before an election.

title: Trump Races Toward 2024 Biden Rematch After New Hampshire Win
description: Donald Trump put himself on the cusp of clinching the Republican presidential nomination after New Hampshire voters handed him a decisive victory in Tuesday’s primary.

title: Key Takeaways From Trump’s Win in New Hampshire Primary
description: Here are the key takeaways from the 2024 New Hampshire primary. Click here for our TOPLive blog.

title: Biden Beats Back New Hampshire Challenge as Write-In Candidate
description: President Joe Biden fended off a challenge from within his own party in New Hampshire, defeating Representative Dean Phillips in a race seen as a referendum on his ability to beat Republican Donald Trump in November.

title: US Delegation Makes First Trip to Taiwan After Presidential Election
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan (AP) — The co-chairs of the U.S. Congressional Taiwan Caucus on Wednesday opened the first trip by U.S. lawmakers to the island where the independence-leaning Democratic Progressive Party won a third straight term in presidential elections this month.

title: Former Australian PM Morrison Joins Trump Aide’s Consulting Firm
description: Former Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, who announced this week his intention to leave politics and turn to the private sector, plans to join a consulting firm run by Former US President Donald Trump’s national security adviser.

title: Indonesian VP Candidate to Leave Cabinet Post Before Election
description: Indonesia’s vice presidential hopeful Mahfud MD said he plans to quit his role as a senior minister, less than a month away from elections to prevent any conflict of interest.

title: North Korea Fires Cruise Missiles to Ratchet Up Pressure
description: North Korea fired multiple cruise missiles into waters off its west coast, stepping up tensions after leader Kim Jong Un said he plans to boost the country’s nuclear-strike capabilities.

title: US Concerned by Venezuelan Government’s Actions Against Opposition
description: A top Biden administration official said that the US is concerned by actions that Venezuela’s government has taken against the opposition and civil society a few months after an agreement aimed at fostering a competitive and fair vote in presidential elections later this year.

title: Biden Wins New Hampshire Democratic Primary
description: President Joe Biden won the New Hampshire Democratic primary by write-in, NBC and ABC say, despite not having his name printed on the ballot.

title: Trump Wins New Hampshire Republican Primary Over Haley
description: Former President Donald Trump won the New Hampshire primary, dealing a blow to his only remaining major rival Nikki Haley and solidifying his status as the Republican party’s likely nominee.

title: UK’s Cameron to Visit Middle East to Push for Gaza Ceasefire
description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron will travel to the Middle East and Turkey this week, part of the latest effort to push for a sustainable ceasefire in the conflict between Israel and Hamas.

title: China Says EU’s ‘Unfair’ EV Subsidies Probe Risks Damaging Ties
description: China’s ambassador to the European Union called the bloc’s probe into Chinese electric vehicle manufacturers over state subsidies “unfair,” delivering a veiled warning that more European products could face trade investigations.
